Text:
I have a huge problem. Yesterday I mistaken development and production terminals opened side-by-side and ran

    git add .
on production. That caused stashing all files in public/uploads path. When I tried

    git status
It showed all files in public/uploads are stashed and ready to commit. But I never commited these changes, because on production I don't want any commits or pushes. SSH key on production doesn't have permission to push, only clone/pull.

So I ran these commands to force pull my new code from remote repository

    git fetch --all
    git reset --hard  origin/master
    git pull origin master
But now I find out that it has deleted all files in public/uploads path and the directory it self. When I check

    git status
I see "Your branch is up-to-date with 'origin/master' ". Is there a way how to recover files from deleted directory? These files are pretty important...

Thank you, or all suggestions

Comment: Fixed a couple of mistakes, removed the "thank you" line
